steps.title: Open the qBitTorrent website.
steps.content: Open the qBitTorrent website. Go to https://www.qbittorrent.org/download in your computer's web browser. While most torrent applications will allow you to create a torrent, qBitTorrent is the only ad-free torrent client which is available for Windows, Mac, and Linux. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select a download link.
steps.content: Select a download link. Depending on your operating system, click one of the following options: Windows — Click 64-bit installer to the right of the "Mirror link" heading in the Windows section. Mac — Click DMG to the right of the "Mirror link" heading in the Mac section.

steps.title: Double-click the downloaded setup file.
steps.content: Double-click the downloaded setup file. This will open the file.

steps.title: Install qBitTorrent.
steps.content: Install qBitTorrent. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019. Depending on your computer's operating system, do the following: Windows — Click Yes when prompted, then follow the on-screen installation prompts. Mac — Drag the qBitTorrent app icon onto the "Applications" folder shortcut, then follow any on-screen instructions. You may need to verify the download before qBitTorrent will install.

steps.title: Open the torrent tracker list.
steps.content: Open the torrent tracker list. Go to https://www.torrenttrackerlist.com/torrent-tracker-list/ in your computer's web browser.

steps.title: Scroll down to the tracker list.
steps.content: Scroll down to the tracker list. It's under the "Torrent Tracker List" heading near the top of the page.

steps.title: Select ONE URL in the list.
steps.content: Select ONE URL in the list. Click and drag your mouse cursor across a URL in the list to select. You can release the mouse button once you reach the end line.

steps.title: Copy the URL.
steps.content: Copy the URL. Press Ctrl + C (Windows) or ⌘ Command + C (Mac) to do so. [3] X Research source At this point, you're ready to begin creating your torrent.

steps.title: Open qBitTorrent.
steps.content: Open qBitTorrent. Click or double-click the qBitTorrent app icon, which resembles a "qb" on a blue background. You may need to click I Agree before qBitTorrent will open.

steps.title: Click Tools.
steps.content: Click Tools . It's at the top of the qBitTorrent window (Windows) or the screen (Mac). A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Torrent Creator.
steps.content: Click Torrent Creator . You'll see this in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the Torrent Creator window.

steps.title: Click Select file.
steps.content: Click Select file . It's near the top of the page. A pop-up window will appear. If you want to create a torrent using an entire folder, click Select folder here instead.

steps.title: Select the file you want to use.
steps.content: Select the file you want to use. Go to the folder location of the file (or folder) you want to use, click once the file or folder, and click Open or Choose .

steps.title: Check the "Start seeding immediately" box.
steps.content: Check the "Start seeding immediately" box. This will ensure that you are uploading the torrent's files, meaning that someone else will be able to download them. Failing to seed your torrent's files will result in a dead torrent.

steps.title: Enter your copied tracker URLs.
steps.content: Enter your copied tracker URLs. Click the "Tracker URLs" text box in the "Fields" section of the menu, then press Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ Command + V (Mac) to paste in the URLs you copied earlier. Many of the trackers in this list won't work, which is why you're copying and pasting all of them into the URL text box instead of just selecting one.

steps.title: Click Create Torrent.
steps.content: Click Create Torrent . It's at the bottom of the window. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Select a save location.
steps.content: Select a save location. Click the folder in which you want to save your created torrent file.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will save your file and begin seeding the torrent, meaning that the torrent is now available for download.

steps.title: Send the torrent to a friend.
steps.content: Send the torrent to a friend. For someone to download your torrent's files, they'll just need to double-click the torrent to open it in their default torrent application and then confirm the torrent's files' download location. [4] X Research source As long as you're seeding the torrent, your friend should be able to download the torrent with no trouble.
